Acute adrenal insufficiency can be a sign of the disease, in particular:

*In the neonatal period: complete adrenal enzyme block (21-hydroxylase +++).
*In adulthood
**Addison's disease
**bilateral adrenal haemorrhage
**pituitary apoplexy.

question.title: Acute adrenal insufficiency can be a sign of the disease, in particular:
question.description: What is a possible cause of acute adrenal insufficiency in adulthood?

option_a.title: Addison's disease
option_a.description: A condition characterized by the destruction of the adrenal glands

option_b.title: Chronic adrenal insufficiency
option_b.description: A condition where the adrenal glands do not produce enough hormones over time
